intro: Gnaphalodes, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Gnaphalodes species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They produce small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens.
